conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls are extruded with visible thickness, multiple wall faces are shown, interior volume is readable from an elevated angled view, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and floor/wall separation; cutaway is clean. Slight softness/ambiguity at some wall junctions and openings reduces precision.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall macro-zoning resembles the 2D plan (kitchen run at top-right, small WC near top-center, utility/mechanical cluster near center-right, dining area with right-side bay). However, several internal partitions and exact wall lengths/offsets do not tightly match the 2D, and the breakfast/pantry/doorway relationships are simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen cabinetry/counters and a toilet are present, but most room-defining furniture/fixtures (dining set, utility/HVAC details, doors) are missing or overly abstract, limiting verification of room identity.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good readability of walls vs floors and adequate lighting. Some openings (doors/windows) are not clearly defined, reducing structural clarity for verification.

detected_errors.description: Layout fidelity is approximate: several partition placements and proportions appear simplified relative to the 2D plan, reducing confidence in exact room boundaries and adjacencies.
Doors/windows are not consistently modeled (many door locations/opening sizes are absent or ambiguous compared to the 2D plan).
Non-kitchen furnishings/fixtures are largely missing, limiting room-identity confirmation (e.g., dining/utility details).

summary: This is a valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong wall/volume depiction, but the plan-to-model geometric fidelity is only moderate due to simplified partitions and incomplete/unclear door-window detailing.
